intro: Gaertnera boivinii, commonly known as the Boivin's gaertnera, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Gaertnera boivinii is considered a rare and endangered species.
